result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A. Angus Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Prescriptions, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk with response from Judge

****************AMENDED COURT MINUTES - NOVEMBER 14, 2014*************************

Defendant Scott A. Angus in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin (Atty Cousins appeared on behalf of Atty Constable)

2:34 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
State does not have any corrections/changes to the PSI.
Defense does not have any corrections/changes to the PSI.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Court informs the parties that the defendant had been in Court on Monday for a disordely conduct charge.
Atty Schmidt takes a few minutes to speak with his client.

2:42 p.m.  Court is back on the record and appearances remain the same.
New file will not be able to resolved today; Atty Cousins states he is not the ADA assigned and does not want to make a decision on the new charge.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant does not wish to make any statements on his behalf.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose 180 day jail sentence and stay the sentence
Probation 2 years
Maintain full-time employment.
Not to be in possession of any controlled substances unless with a valid prescription; all prescriptions are to be immediately reported to the assigned agent.
Take medications/prescriptions only as prescribed. Inform Agent of all medications.
Sign releases of information for treatment providers and pharmacies as requested by the agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations; any other assessments as recommend by the agent.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay fine of $300 + court costs which includes the DNA surcharge 
Submit to DNA sample.
Complete 40 hours of community service.

Count 2 -
Comply with conditions in Count 1.
Probation is concurrent on these file.
Pay costs.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on October 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Scott A. Angus in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:28 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.
Address of Defendant is verified. Defendant is moving to a different address on Friday, does not know the new address.

There is a plea agreement that has been reached.

State does not have an amended information, but Count 1 would be amended to 961.41(3g)(AM) Class I Felony. State will file the amended information shortly after this hearing.
Defendant will plead to the amended charge of Count 1 and to Count 2 as charged.
State anticipates a PSI to be ordered and will cap the sentence at : withheld sentence, 3 yrs prob, 40 hrs comm svcs, aoda and comply, abs sob as to drugs and alcohol, no drug provisions, refill all prescriptions from a single pharmacy, sign releases of information, obt/mnt ft empt, other counseling.

Atty Schmidt concurs.
Defendant concurs. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 - amended charge
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Court takes a moment to re-review the criminal complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: 961.41(3g)(am) Class I Felony
Count 2: Possess/Intent/Deliver Prescriptions

State is anticipating a PSI to be ordered.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.
Bond is continued.

Court advises Defendant to update the Clerk of Court's office with any change of address.
Voting Notice is given to Defense for review and completion.

9:47 AM Court is in recess.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Plea hearing on July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Scott A. Angus in court with attorney Karl A Schmidt. ADA Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances unlawfully.
